page.title: 04Gate House Farm Brenchley.
page.content: The farm covers{80}acres,growing half{soft fruit}(some "Pick Your Own") and half{apples.}Bees for pollinating the trees are hired from{Gloucester. {Grapes}are a new venture,they go to {Lamberhurst}for processing.The owners, {3}full time and{9}part time workers form the staff.In summer up to{200} pickers are employed,transported by an old double decker bus.Machines are hired to pick blackcurrants when a heavy crop justifies the expense.Crops are threatened by birds,rabbits and milldew:wire and spraying are used to help combat these.{The best day on the {farm is when the last apple is picked. Most produce is sold direct to {local {supermarkets.} The irrigation lake is being developed as a {conservation}area for {rare wet plants}and visitors are welcome to follow the{farm trail.}
